result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah Leonard Coleman

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in court. Defendant advised that his attorney is in trial and the case has been adjourned. Defendant given new court date slip.

Defendant Jeremiah Leonard Coleman not in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Jeremiah Leonard Coleman.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant does not appear. Defense counsel advises the Court he is in trial and requests an adjournment. State does not object. Case adjourned back to OCCR. Adjourned appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-26-2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for bail hearing to address Justice Point discharge. Defendant failing to appear.  On the State's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. Court takes no action as to bail.
Hearing scheduled for August 11th, 2022 at 8:30 via Zoom to address the JusticePoint discharge report received by the Court.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing. Defense informed the court they were recently appointed and needs the defendant's contact information as well as case materials.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hezekiah L.C.;  Teanna B.C.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Jeremiah Leonard Coleman in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Jeremiah Leonard Coleman in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremiah Leonard Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defense requests to be heard on bail to address the no contact order.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
